extracted_data_phrases: through my actions , words , or decisions

disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: Did you reject the unity of the Church in your thoughts when feeling frustrated by individuals within it, especially those who may have disappointed or hurt you?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did you intentionally skip fasting on solemn days, thereby showing disrespect to God's commandments?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

extracted_data_phrases: to influences that contradict the teachings of the Catholic Church

adultery.question: Did I, in my marriage, forgo a valid Catholic sacrament?
adultery.description: For Catholics, marriage is sacramental and needs to occur in the Church or receive a dispensation if either people are not Catholic.

extracted_data_phrases: from those who are homeless or displaced

uncharity.question: Did I let my own interests overshadow the needs and well-being of others?

uncharity.description: Losing patience with others fails to reflect God's infinite patience with us and violates Christ's command to love our neighbor, instead allowing anger and frustration to override charity and kindness.

uncharity.question: Did I lose my patience with others, particularly when dealing with challenging situations or people?
uncharity.description: Losing patience with others fails to reflect God's infinite patience with us and violates Christ's command to love our neighbor, instead allowing anger and frustration to override charity and kindness.

uncharity.question: Did you lose your patience in conversations with others?

uncharity.question: Did I permit someone else to be denied justice or treated unfairly in any situation?

uncharity.question: Have I not failed to lend assistance when it was needed by others?

uncharity.question: Have I neglected to lend assistance when someone nearby needed help?

callousness.question: Did I fail to assist someone in need when they were sick?

prodigality.question: Have I allowed excessive and wasteful spending on leisure activities to take precedence over my financial obligations or family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I been excessively wasteful in my financial dealings, putting unnecessary risks over essential responsibilities?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing someone else 's private affairs
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing someone else's private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in speaking poorly about others, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did you unnecessarily engage in an activity on Sunday, a holy day of rest and worship?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
